text: Consultation and engagement 4.6 There are three main engagement/consultation stages as part of the Local Plan process. The council is now at the final stage before the draft plan is submited to the Secretary of State. These stages have provided an opportunity for all community members and stakeholders to provide feedback on what a new local plan should include, whether initial ideas and concepts are right, whether the themes are consistent with community aspirations or if anything has been missed. All feedback has been reviewed in detail and used to inform the next stages of the Local Plan process. All representations submitted at this stage will be collated and submitted to the independent planning inspector. Tower Hamlets Local Plan 13 INTRODUCTION 5. Consultation and engagement
